docs.lead_paragraph: Amid speculation about what a health care overhaul might mean for Medicare, what do the people who actually run the program have to say?

headline.main: What Medicare Says About Medicare Changes

docs.abstract: Health Secretary Sebelius publishes a report meant to reassure Medicare patients.
docs.snippet: Health Secretary Sebelius publishes a report meant to reassure Medicare patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael S. Steele, the chairman of the Republican National Committee, said in an interview broadcast Thursday that he wanted to protect Medicare while also remaining steadfast in his opposition to what he called President Obama's "government-run health care system."

headline.main: Republican Chairman Is of Two Minds on Medicare

docs.abstract: Michael Steele wants to protect Medicare, but cut it, too.
docs.snippet: Michael Steele wants to protect Medicare, but cut it, too.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you've been wondering why the health care industry - the drug makers, the health insurers, the hospitals, the doctors - hasn't done more to oppose the health overhaul effort, Robert Laszweski offers an answer in a column published Thursday on Kaiser Health News.

headline.main: Industry Could Reap 'Billions of Dollars' From Overhaul

docs.abstract: A health industry consultant says there is little not to like for hospitals, doctors and insurers in the health care bills now circulating in Congress.
docs.snippet: A health industry consultant says there is little not to like for hospitals, doctors and insurers in the health care bills now circulating in Congress.

docs.lead_paragraph: The opening of a new Whole Foods store on the Upper West Side on Thursday has been interpreted in various ways. Some people in the neighborhood welcome the wide selection of expensive groceries and organic items that the upscale supermarket chain represents. Others bemoan the continuing gentrification of the neighborhood, noting that the new store was inserted into the middle-income Park West Village complex over protests from many residents.

headline.main: Single-Payer Health Care Advocates Picket Whole Foods

docs.abstract: The protesters were outraged by an essay in which the chief executive of Whole Foods criticized President Obama's health care proposals.
docs.snippet: The protesters were outraged by an essay in which the chief executive of Whole Foods criticized President Obama's health care proposals.

byline.original: By SEWELL CHAN and JENNIFER 8. LEE

docs.lead_paragraph: Whether health care legislation pending in Congress will cover abortion services - and if so, how those services would be paid for - is proving predictably divisive. In an electronic "town hall kit" published earlier this week, the Family Research Council, like other conservative groups, raised the prospect that taxpayers would be required to "pay for abortion on demand" and to "fund the leading provider of abortion in the nation, Planned Parenthood."
docs.abstract: Would pending health care legislation expand abortion coverage?
docs.snippet: Would pending health care legislation expand abortion coverage?

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 12:00 p.m. Even as financial stocks have rallied nearly 60 percent since the end of March, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation issued another grim report card Thursday on the health of the nation's banks.
docs.abstract: With bank failures rising, the government's deposit insurance fund fell 20 percent to $10.4 billion in the second quarter, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said.
docs.snippet: With bank failures rising, the government's deposit insurance fund fell 20 percent to $10.4 billion in the second quarter, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said.

docs.lead_paragraph: This week the Modern Healthcare Web site posted its list of the most influential people in the health care system.

headline.main: The 100 Most Powerful People in Health Care

docs.abstract: This week the Modern Healthcare Web site posted its list of the most influential people in the health care system.
docs.snippet: This week the Modern Healthcare Web site posted its list of the most influential people in the health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: The official mourning ceremonies for Senator Edward M. Kennedy begin this Thursday, with three days of tributes and services planned.
docs.abstract: The long procession toward the senator's burial on Saturday begins this morning.
docs.snippet: The long procession toward the senator's burial on Saturday begins this morning.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Wall Street Journal today serves up two conservative attacks on President Obama's health care effort. The former Bush adviser Karl Rove notes that President Obama has made a cost-cutting target of the Medicare Advantage program, which is a variety of Medicare offered by private insurers.
docs.abstract: Karl Rove and Betsy McCaughey take aim at President Obama's health care plan.
docs.snippet: Karl Rove and Betsy McCaughey take aim at President Obama's health care plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Society may not prize manual labor, but that may be where the jobs are.
docs.snippet: Society may not prize manual labor, but that may be where the jobs are.
